metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5361 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
Request Tracker (RT) 4.x before 4.0.25, 4.2.x before 4.2.14, and 4.4.xbefore 4.4.2 does not use a constant-time comparison algorithm for secrets,which makes it easier for remote attackers to obtain sensitive userpassword information via a timing side-channel attack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5361` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

request-tracker4 - 4.4.1-4
rt4-apache2 - 4.4.1-4
rt4-clients - 4.4.1-4
rt4-db-mysql - 4.4.1-4
rt4-db-postgresql - 4.4.1-4
rt4-db-sqlite - 4.4.1-4
rt4-fcgi - 4.4.1-4
rt4-standalone - 4.4.1-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: request-tracker4 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.1-4').
